VEF is the former currency of Venezuela, which was replaced by the Bolívar Soberano (VES) in 2018. Therefore, VEF is no longer a valid currency and has no current Japanese translation.|VEF

XOF is the currency code for West African CFA franc. Here are some valid translations:

XOF|CFAフラン|フランコ・コンゴフランセ|フランコ・アフリカン・ド・ウエスト|XOF
DKK|クローネ|デンマーククローネ|DKK

BOB stands for Bolivian Boliviano. Here are some valid translations:

BOB | ボリビア・ボリビアーノ | ボリビアの通貨 | ボリビアのお金|BOB
IDR|Rp|ルピア|インドネシアルピア|IDR
KHR|カンボジア リエル|KHR
BEF was the currency of Belgium until it was replaced by the euro. Its valid translation is: BEF|ベルギー・フラン|BEF

ZWD is no longer a valid currency code. It was replaced by the RTGS dollar (ZWL) in 2019. Here are the translations for ZWL:

ZWL|RTGSドル|ジンバブエドル|ZWD

MRO stands for Mauritanian Ouguiya, the currency of Mauritania. Here are the valid translations:

MRO|モーリタニア ウギア|モーリタニア ウギヤ|MRO

ZWL is the ISO code for the Zimbabwean dollar. However, due to the high inflation rate in Zimbabwe, the government has suspended the use of the Zimbabwean dollar and adopted foreign currencies such as the US dollar, South African rand, and British pound. Therefore, there are no commonly used translations for ZWL at the moment.|ZWL
